item.title: Waste bin has not been emptied for 8 weeks now. Fly tipping around it, rodents spotted., 9th June
item.description:
There seems to be an issue with waste disposal for the “business centre” and/or Papdam restaurant. This is the second time I am reporting the tenants/ clients dumping rubbish. Are you able to investigate what waste disposal these landlord have in place and why is it not maintained properly? It attracts rodents to the area and is a very bad look. This is not Lewisham. Please address it with the property owners.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tylney Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poisonous Hemlock Plant - please remove today !, 9th June
item.description:
This plant needs to be removed right now. Hemlock can be deadly. This plant is growing on the pavement verge next to the letter box, near the junction of Mereworth and Bushmoor. It's right next to the footpath. People may brush against it without knowing. The plant is flowering and it may start spreading seeds soon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mereworth Drive, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enfield council waste services and street cleaning, 9th June
item.description:
On the 8th May I met with senior waste services operator, Robert and one other man from the council. This was organised by Lee Shelsher, who was trying to help by arranging a meeting so I could point out the littered streets of concern. These include Winchmore Hill road, Eversely park road, Avenue road and Church hill, rarely cleaned and never properly cleaned by the council. These roads are all in Winchmore Hill, steadily in decline. My overall concerns I have collated for the ombudsman. But I would like my concern noted, that those streets had been fairly cleaned just before our meeting. My own road, college road, was cleaned for the first time in months. Robert insisted to me that residential streets were cleaned once a week. This is still entirely untrue, all of which I can evidence in a court of law. According to the stated cleaning rota, the council will not make public, Hoppers road is swept every Monday. Today is the third Monday now with zero street clean or cleanse of Hoppers road. The bin is never emptied and by Friday is overflowing. There are no frontline services and flats like those on Winchmore Hill road have become filthy with fly tips and overflow across the street. The section of church hill outside St Paul’s is never cleaned and a shaming indictment on the council s lack of respect towards church buildings. I am very concerned at the fact that this behaviour from a senior operative is essentially gaslighting and unprofessional behaviour. We can’t even get bins emptied anymore and Winchmore Hill is steadily looking like a filthy ghetto. The regular fly tipper on aversely park road N21 is never investigated and her dumped nappies and cigarette packs are picked up by me every day. To confirm, the roads are not cleaned once a week, or even once a month. Hoppers road will be on its fourth week uncleared by the council next week. In addition, this non cleaning is feeling targeted against me, like the online abuse I have faced from senior members of staff across the council, including Rick Jewell I also have not had a response to the petition to ask street cleaning and waste services to keep Enfield’s streets cleaned, sent to Ergin Erbil, Perry Scott and other senior leaders. All of the Bon removals have not helped and people are creating their own bins by liking up passing litter. Lytton avenue attached has not been cleaned for three weeks either.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Bourne Hill, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
